text:
Hi there my name's Tom Dyer I am 2 time world
champion 2 time Guinness world record holder

and 12 time UK champion flair bartender we're
here up in Manchester and I'm gonna be making

a mojito using flair bartending now to do
this we're using 360 bullet time where there's

32 camera's surrounding me and they're all
taking a picture at the same time so you're

getting a 360 degree view of the moves that
I'm performing now what's flair may you ask

it's a style of bartending which involves
manipulating the objects maybe even the liquid

to make it a little bit more entertaining
to the customer when you're making a cocktail

I got into flair bartending about 15 years
ago when I started working behind the bar

and somebody showed me a couple of different
flair moves then I went to see a competition

at the roadhouse grand finals when I saw the
professionals doing their thing over there

I wanted to do the same thing I quit university
I quit my job and I started to flair and the

rest is history as they say so this shoot
came about when I got a phone call many months

ago asking if I wanted to be involved in Jamie
Oliver's Drinks Tube did a screen test then

a few months after that got another phone
call asked to come back and we came up with

some ideas and I was told that there was going
to be this 360 degree bullet camera super

slow mo camera and I thought the best way
to showcase flair so that the people who love

flair get to see it in it's best possible
light and those people who don't really understand

what's going on get to see all different angles
of how flair works ok so to see me making

a mojito with flair bartending in 360 degree
bullet time just click right here!
